ext_description.p:
A Fabrication_joint is a type of . A Fabrication_joint identifies a joint that is created in the fabrication of a printed circuit board. A Fabrication_joint is usually provided only when it is necessary to state that an intersection of a
and includes additional material. A Fabrication_joint may be used when the preferred method of asserting that a joint exists between a
and a
is unsuitable.
The preferred method of asserting that a joint exists between a
and a
is to populate a member of
at the same location as the
and specify that the
is in the role of location for the
that is in the role of
for the .
ext_description.note:
The preferred method of asserting that a joint exists between the
and the
may be unsuitable when the pre-processor uses the end point of the centreline of the
as a location of the
but the centreline of the
does not intersect the
associated with the location of the .

example.p:
Figure 1 is a plan view of the construction of a Fabrication_joint between a and a
where both contribute to a segment. This figure illustrates the geometric relationship of the element terminals in the construction of the segment. In this example, the Fabrication_joint is provided because auxiliary material intended to increase manufacturability of the local metalization in the area of the intersection is provided.

figure.title: Land to Conductive interconnect element Fabrication_joint exploded view

ext_description.note:
The placement of the of the
in Figure 1 is atypical of usual design practice and is provided only for illustrative purposes. Normal design practice with this geometry would be for the end of the
to be conguent with the center of the

A Fabrication_joint may be provided by a pre-processor where there are known accuracy issues regarding the location of the intersection of a
and a
and it is necessary to provide auxiliary information that indicates the intent of the designer.
A Fabrication_joint may be used where there is a need to do a detailed analysis of manufacturing process variations due to use of state of the art feature size and spacing dimensions.
Fabrication joint is not a native CAD system concept and must be synthesized as needed by a pre-processor.

example.p: Figure 2 is a cross-sectional view of the construction of a Fabrication_joint between a and a .

figure.title: Land to Component termination passage exploded view

for the Fabrication_joint.

for the Fabrication_joint. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: The fabrication_feature_1 shall not be the fabrication_feature_2.
The fabrication_feature_1 shall not be the auxiliary_joint_material.
The fabrication_feature_2 shall not be the auxiliary_joint_material.

A Connection_zone_based_fabrication_joint is a type of . A Connection_zone_based_fabrication_joint specializes the definition of by providing additional detail showing specific connection areas on each end of the joint. zone_1 is a connection area on
and zone_2 is a connection area on .
ext_description.note: A Connection_zone_based_fabrication_joint is rarely used. Implementation projects should carefully review the source data to validate the implementation requirement before implementing this Application Object.

ext_description.p: specifies a role of the for the Connection_zone_based_fabrication_joint.
ext_description.note: There are no semantics associated with the sequence of zones in a Connection_zone_based_fabrication_joint.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies a role of the for the Connection_zone_based_fabrication_joint.
The zone_1 shall not be zone_2.

A Passage_terminal_based_fabrication_joint_link is a directed link between two that are associated with a common conductive passage in the interconnect substrate. A Passage_terminal_based_fabrication_joint_link is provided to support construction of a tree representation of the connection paths in the substrate to support analysis or synthesis activities. A Passage_terminal_based_fabrication_joint_link is unnecessary for basic description of the connections in the substrate.
specifies the role of the for the Passage_terminal_based_fabrication_joint_link.
specifies the role of the for the Passage_terminal_based_fabrication_joint_link.
specifies the role of the for the Passage_terminal_based_fabrication_joint_link.
The combination of associated_terminal, precedent_point and subsequent_point shall be unique within a population of Passage_terminal_based_fabrication_joint_link.
The precedent_point shall not be the subsequent_point.
The terminal referenced by the attribute of the referenced by precedent_point shall be the terminal referenced by associated_terminal.
The terminal referenced by the attribute of the referenced by subsequent_point shall be the terminal referenced by associated_terminal.
The associated_terminal shall only be of type , or of type .

ext_description.p: The graph of instances of the Application Object Passage_terminal_based_fabrication_joint_link shall not contain a cycle.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
The acyclic_passage_terminal_based_fabrication_joint_link function determines whether the graph of instances of the Application Object type
that contains relation as one of its links contains a cycle. This function may be used to evaluate
or any of it's subtypes.
